common.getInTouchDescription: We will answer your questions, help identify potential paths forward, provide technical support and connect you with relevant industry leaders

contactForm.successMessage: We've received your message and someone from our enterprise team will get back to you within a few business days.

errors.invalidEmail: Please enter a valid email address
errors.businessEmailRequired: Please use a business, institutional, or organizational email address (e.g., no @gmail).
errors.generalError: Unable to send your message. Please try again or contact us directly at

numbers.heading: Ethereum is the Backbone of the Onchain Economy
numbers.networkSecurityLabel: Total value securing the network ({ethAmount} ETH)

useCases.heading: Institutional Use Cases
useCases.subheading: Explore Ethereum's digital asset landscape, from tokens to technologies

rwa.label: RWAs & Stablecoins
rwa.description: Real-world assets tokenize offchain assets, like real estate, commodities, or bonds, while stablecoins design for steady value, often pegged to assets like USD.

defi.label: Decentralized Finance
defi.description: Open financial systems built on smart contracts instead of banks. DeFi lets anyone lend, borrow, trade, and earn yield directly from their wallet.

privacy.label: Privacy & Compliance
privacy.description: Deploy on Ethereum's public Mainnet for global transparency, or use enterprise-grade privacy solutions for confidentiality and control.

layer2.label: L2 Ecosystem
layer2.description: Layer 2 networks scale Ethereum by processing transactions faster and cheaper.

resilience.label: Resilience
resilience.description: Ethereum has maintained {uptime} of uninterrupted uptime and liveness since its launch. Zero downtime through 15+ successful network upgrades.

flexibility.label: Flexibility
flexibility.description: Open source, with complete freedom from lock-in to any single vendor, stack, or architecture. Institutions retain full optionality for their onchain products as business requirements change.

neutrality.label: Credible Neutrality
neutrality.description: No single point of failure, no central coordinator, no pause button, no counterparty risk. Resilient to geopolitical, regulatory, and infrastructure-level risks.

decentralization.label: Decentralization
decentralization.description: Secured by {validatorCount}+ validators distributed across geographies and client implementations. {securityValue}+ in economic security makes Ethereum the most expensive smart contract platform to attack.

liquidity.label: Deep Liquidity
liquidity.description: {dexVolume}+ in daily DEX volume, the deepest liquidity of any onchain environment. Ethereum is the chosen liquidity layer for institutions to build leading next-gen products.

tokenization.label: Tokenization
tokenization.description: The leading platform for asset tokenization, with {rwaMarketShare} of all onchain RWAs deployed on Ethereum and its L2s, and {stablecoinTvl} in stablecoin TVL.

scaling.heading: Ethereum is Scaling
scaling.description: Ethereum's performance isn't static. The network's active R&D roadmap sets the stage for an infinitely-scalable ecosystem, while Ethereum-based providers globally push throughput boundaries today.

immediateAcceleration.title: Immediate Acceleration
immediateAcceleration.card1: Raising mainnet gas limit to 100M/block rapidly increases mainnet TPS
immediateAcceleration.card2: PeerDAS data availability sampling scales blob capacity, multiplying L2 TPS
immediateAcceleration.card3: History expiry prunes storage to keep node performance comfortable at scale

alternativeProvider.title: Alternative Provider Innovation
alternativeProvider.card1: Eigen DA throughput reaches 100MB/second, allowing Ethereum rollups to operate at 12.8x Visa's peak throughput and enabling >800K ERC-20 transfers per second
alternativeProvider.card2: ZKSync's Airbender reaches up to 6x faster proving throughput than competitors, proving Ethereum blocks in real-time with 8 nvidia 5090 GPUs, and unlocking real-time clearing for latency-sensitive finance

activeDevelopment.title: Active Development
activeDevelopment.card1: PeerDAS data availability sampling sets the stage to 8x today's mainnet throughput
activeDevelopment.card2: Block-Level Access Lists enable parallel transaction execution within blocks and parallel state root computation, accelerating block processing times

terabyteScale.title: Terabyte-Scale Vision
terabyteScale.card1Item1: 1 gigagas/sec on L1: 10K TPS, ambitious vertical scale
terabyteScale.card1Item2: 1 teragas/sec on L2: 10M TPS, sprawling horizontal scale
terabyteScale.card2: Lean Ethereum proposal targets finality in seconds, post-quantum blob storage, and execution performance boosts

metadata.title: Ethereum for Institutions | The Institutional Liquidity Layer
metadata.description: Discover why leading institutions build on Ethereum. Unmatched resilience, deep liquidity, and proven security for the onchain economy. Explore use cases.

hero.heading: Stablecoins & Real-World Assets on Ethereum
hero.description: Ethereum is the dominant network for asset tokenization, home to over 75% of all tokenized real-world assets (RWAs) and over 60% of global stablecoin supply

overview.description: Institutions tokenize stocks, offer 24/7 settlement, deploy programmable cash, launch payment rails, and more, on the liquid, open, and resilient ecosystem of Ethereum and its L2s

infrastructure.heading: Ethereum as Financial Market Infrastructure
infrastructure.description: Ethereum hosts the largest, most connected stablecoin ecosystem for payments, treasury, and settlement: plugging straight into wallets, exchanges, and DeFi
infrastructure.depthDesc: Ethereum mainnet hosts the majority of all onchain stablecoins
infrastructure.scaleDesc: Ethereum's Layer 2s add low-fee rails for retail and high-frequency flows
infrastructure.complianceDesc: Programmable settlement for compliance, disclosures, and auditability
infrastructure.yieldDesc: Access familiar instruments, like T-bills and short-duration products

stablecoins.heading: Stablecoins on Ethereum
stablecoins.marketCap: Total stablecoin market cap on Ethereum L1:

rwas.heading: Real-World Assets (RWAs) on Ethereum
rwas.totalSector: Total RWA sector on Ethereum L1:

why.heading: Why Ethereum for Financial Market Infrastructure
why.description: Credible settlement, global reach. Ethereum pairs a maximally-neutral L1 settlement layer with L2 execution environments that deliver scale and cost efficiency, so institutions can move cash-like value and short-duration assets with auditability and programmatic controls.

l1.heading: Ethereum L1
l1.finalityDesc: High-value settlement, state roots for rollups, and durable records institutions can audit and attest against
l1.securityDesc: Assets can be stored in an environment that is built to withstand major catastrophes and geopolitical tensions
l1.riskGatingDesc: Keep complex or experimental logic off L1; use it for final settlement, collateral custody, and proofs

l2.heading: Ethereum's L2s
l2.throughputDesc: Rollups process transactions off-chain, inherit L1 security, and deliver low fees suitable for payments, market-making, and high-frequency flows
l2.configurableDesc: L2s can add compliance features, like allowlisting or KYC'd pools, while remaining non-custodial and settling to L1
l2.specializationDesc: Multiple L2s let institutions segregate workloads, such as retail payments vs. treasury ops, without fragmenting trust, because settlement reconciles on L1

metadata.title: Stablecoins & Asset Tokenization | RWAs on Ethereum
metadata.description: Ethereum is the dominant choice for tokenizing assets and issuing stablecoins. Explore the network for 24/7 settlement, programmable cash, and onchain yield.

hero.heading: Compliant Privacy for Institutions
hero.description1: On Ethereum, you can keep counterparties, data, and business logic confidential while settling against the deepest onchain liquidity.
hero.description2: Privacy isn't a sidechain or a silo. It's a set of open standards you compose on L1 or L2 to meet regulatory, risk, and audit needs.

direct.heading: A Privacy Strike Team for Institutions
direct.description: The Ethereum Foundation pairs its cryptographic research team (PSE) of 50+ leading privacy researchers with its Institutional Privacy Task Force (IPTF) to deliver institutional-grade privacy on public rails
direct.neutralStacksDesc: Avoid vendor lock-in with privacy stacks that map to institutional use cases. IPTF advises, designs, and ships vendor-neutral privacy solutions on Ethereum.
direct.complianceDesc: Co-design policy proofs that satisfy enterprise audit standards and regulation. PSE works to advance onchain privacy solutions and auditability for real-world adoption.
direct.pilotsDesc: Stand up pilots that settle publicly and compose with existing liquidity, while keeping specific counterparties, amounts, and logic confidential.
direct.educationDesc: We engage directly to identify privacy needs and onchain solutions, publishing guidance and reports to share learnings and accelerate safe, compliant adoption.

zk.label: Zero-Knowledge Proofs (ZK)
zk.description: Prove policy checks (KYC, limits, SOW) without exposing raw data. Enable selective disclosure for regulators and counterparties while keeping transactions composable with Ethereum liquidity.

fhe.label: Fully Homomorphic Encryption (FHE)
fhe.description: Compute on encrypted data (risk, pricing, and netting). An early tech that's advancing quickly. FHE is best for highly-sensitivity analytics, where even intermediaries shouldn't see plaintext.

tee.label: Trusted Execution Environments (TEE)
tee.description: Hardware-attested confidential compute for low-latency workflows (matching, auctions). TEEs keep code and data sealed, then emit verifiable attestations suitable for audits and due diligence.

l2.label: Privacy-Focused L2s
l2.description: Confidential rollups settle on Ethereum while keeping counterparties, amounts, and logic private via ZK, FHE or TEEs. Get L1 security, liquidity, and auditability, plus access to selective disclosure.

why.heading: Why Ethereum for Privacy
why.auditReadyDesc: Prove compliance without exposing raw data. Unlock verification of KYC-checks, legitimate sources of funds, and transaction limits, with selective disclosure for regulators and auditors.
why.composabilityDesc: Private flows can still plug into the liquidity on Ethereum and its L2s. Privacy is composable with stablecoin and real-world asset (RWA) rails, DEX liquidity, institutional custody, and more.
why.noLockInDesc: Launch on Ethereum mainnet for maximum composability, or launch on Ethereum's L2s for lower settlement costs, with access to the same privacy tooling and vendor-neutral standards.
why.securityDesc: Privacy features inherit Ethereum's decentralization and resilience. Build future-proof products and services on a global foundation designed for maximum security and permanent availability.

chainlink.heading: Chainlink ACE
chainlink.description: The Automated Compliance Engine provides policy enforcement and verifiable entity identity to automate KYC/AML and transfer rules directly in smart contracts.

railgun.heading: Railgun
railgun.description: Onchain ZK privacy system for private balances and private DeFi interactions on Ethereum and major L2s.

aztec.heading: Aztec Network
aztec.description: Privacy-first zkRollup with encrypted state and selective disclosure; building private smart contracts on Ethereum.

zama.heading: Zama
zama.description: Tools to build smart contracts that compute on encrypted data, so balances and logic stay confidential.

metadata.title: Blockchain Privacy & Compliance for Institutions | Ethereum
metadata.description: Settle onchain while protecting sensitive business data. Explore Ethereum's privacy features and tooling for institutional regulatory, risk, and audit needs.

hero.heading: Library: Institutional Insights
hero.description1: Reports, articles, and analyses from across the institutional landscape, along with thought leadership and updates from the Ethereum Foundation's Enterprise Acceleration team.
hero.description2: Explore market trends, technical developments, and strategic opportunities for institutions building in the onchain economy.

metadata.title: Research & Insights | Ethereum Institutional Resources
metadata.description: Explore a curated library for businesses adopting Ethereum, with reports, analysis, market trends, and the latest institutional insights.

hero.heading: The Home of Decentralized Finance
hero.description1: Ethereum introduced the world to decentralized finance (DeFi): open financial systems built on smart contracts.
hero.description2: 100% uptime, battle-tested and secure infrastructure, and the deepest liquidity layer of any blockchain—Ethereum is for DeFi.

primitives.heading: Ethereum is the Platform for DeFi Primitives
primitives.description: Ethereum's battle-tested, always-on infrastructure secures the largest pool of digital assets and liquidity, powered by the most developers and the broadest blockchain ecosystem. Ethereum doesn't lock users into a single chain, fostering a unified, global ecosystem where innovation and liquidity compound.
primitives.openStandardsDesc: Ethereum's shared EVM, token, and smart contract standards provide interoperability across the entire DeFi ecosystem
primitives.deepLiquidityDesc: Ethereum has the deepest DeFi liquidity of any blockchain, hosting a single, efficient, global marketplace for digital assets
primitives.composableDesc: Open-source building blocks and protocols act as 'money legos' that developers can combine to build sophisticated products
primitives.permissionlessDesc: Anyone can build or access new DeFi instruments, unlocking a dynamic landscape of innovation without gatekeepers
primitives.onchainYieldDesc: Access familiar instruments, like T-bills and short-duration products

innovation.heading: DeFi Powers Enterprise Innovation
innovation.description: Institutions build on Ethereum's open DeFi primitives to advance transparent, efficient, and accessible tools for a global financial system

mas.heading: Monetary Authority of Singapore & J.P. Morgan
mas.description: Live foreign exchange transaction executed via Aave on Polygon L2 mainnet

siemens.heading: Siemens
siemens.description: €60M digital bond issued onchain, sold directly to investors without engaging central securities depositories

visa.heading: Visa
visa.description: Visa Tokenized Asset Platform (VTAP) launched for financial institutions to issue fiat-backed ERC-20 tokens on Ethereum

socgen.heading: Société Générale
socgen.description: Euro and dollar stablecoins integrated with Uniswap and Morpho, for institutional clients to swap, lend, and borrow onchain

ecosystem.heading: Ethereum's DeFi Ecosystem
ecosystem.description: A small selection of DeFi applications that run on Ethereum and its Layer 2 networks

dex.heading: Decentralized Exchanges (DEXs)
dex.subtext: Explore onchain platforms where users can trade tokens anytime, 24/7

platforms.oneInch: A DEX aggregator that sources liquidity from across DEXs and networks to find the best possible swapping routes and rates.
platforms.aerodrome: A decentralized exchange on the Base L2 that combines an AMM with a governance and protocol reward model designed to align incentives.
platforms.balancer: A DeFi protocol that acts as an automated portfolio manager and liquidity provider, allowing users to create or invest in customizable liquidity pools.
platforms.cowSwap: A DEX aggregator built around frequent batch auctions to provide MEV protection, find optimal liquidity, and minimize fees, matching trades peer-to-peer and sending unfilled orders to underlying AMMs.
platforms.curve: A DEX and AMM focused on efficient trading for stablecoins and volatile tokens, using a unique AMM formula to minimize slippage for similarly-priced assets.
platforms.uniswap: A DEX protocol that enables permissionless peer-to-peer trading, through a smart contract-based AMM system that allows anyone to create custom pairs and supply liquidity.

lending-borrowing.heading: Lending & Borrowing
lending-borrowing.subtext: Borrow against onchain collateral and earn yield for supplying liquidity, via smart contracts with programmable terms

platforms.aave: A non-custodial protocol where users can create liquidity markets and participate as suppliers or borrowers, earning interest on supplied digital assets and borrowing against them.
platforms.compound: An algorithmic, autonomous interest rate protocol that allows users to earn interest by lending digital assets to borrowers, designed for developers to build DeFi applications on top of.
platforms.euler: A permissionless protocol for lending, borrowing, and swapping digital assets, featuring asset tiers and reactive interest rates to manage risk, with a modular lending platform for developers to create and connect custom lending vaults.
platforms.fluid: A DeFi protocol that offers lending, borrowing, and trading on top of a unified liquidity layer, allowing users to maximize yield and optimize capital efficiency through integrated debt and liquidity products.
platforms.maple: A decentralized credit market that provides undercollateralized loans to institutional borrowers, and allows lenders to earn yield by supplying liquidity to these curated loans.
platforms.moonwell: An open lending and borrowing protocol designed to simplify the onchain user experience, featuring single-sided liquidity pools and overcollateralized borrowing across markets.
platforms.morpho: A decentralized protocol for overcollateralized, vault-based lending and borrowing, aiming to improve the capital efficiency of lending pools through isolated markets, risk curators, and portfolio allocators.
platforms.sky: A DeFi protocol (created by the MakerDAO community) that offers a suite of tools for trading, converting, staking, and earning yield from digital assets, including the USDS stablecoin.

rwa-yield.heading: Real-World Assets (RWA) & Onchain Yield
rwa-yield.subtext: Tokenized offchain assets, like T-Bills, commodities, or real estate, and onchain comparables to familiar yield instruments

platforms.centrifuge: An asset-agnostic lending protocol that aims to make credit more accessible to businesses, allowing them to tokenize real-world assets and use them as onchain collateral.
platforms.circle: A global financial technology firm that provides payments and financial infrastructure, tokenized money market funds, and more, best known for issuing the fully-regulated USD Coin (USDC) stablecoin.
platforms.ethena: A synthetic dollar protocol focused on providing a crypto-native solution for money, offering USDe, a stablecoin backed by crypto assets and corresponding short futures positions, and a dollar-denominated savings account.
platforms.ftBenji: A mobile app that allows investors to browse tokenized securities, digital assets, and invest in the Franklin OnChain U.S. Government Money Fund (BENJI), the first tokenized money fund natively issued on a blockchain.
platforms.frax: A fractional-algorithmic stablecoin ecosystem that aims to provide scalable, decentralized, and algorithmic money in place of fixed-supply digital assets.
platforms.ondo: A DeFi protocol focused on making institutional-grade financial products and services, like tokenized U.S. Treasuries, accessible onchain.
platforms.pendle: A DeFi protocol for trading interest rate derivatives via the tokenization of future yield, allowing users to lock in future yield from yield-bearing tokens, speculate on yield movements, and provide liquidity for yield-bearing tokens.
platforms.securitize: A platform for tokenizing real-world assets and issuing and managing digital asset securities onchain, allowing businesses to raise capital and investors to trade tokenized shares in funds and private companies.
platforms.skyRwa: A DeFi protocol (created by the MakerDAO community) that offers a suite of tools for trading, converting, staking, and earning yield from digital assets, including the USDS stablecoin.
platforms.tether: Issuer of the the USDT stablecoin, a stablecoin pegged to the U.S. dollar that's focused on using fiat currencies onchain.
platforms.veda: A vault infrastructure platform for institutions to launch and manage custom onchain products at scale.
platforms.wisdomTree: A global asset manager that offers a range of exchange-traded products (ETPs), including physically-backed crypto ETPs.

staking.heading: Staking & Restaking
staking.subtext: Stake ETH through a staking network to help secure Ethereum and earn rewards, or restake LSTs to help secure other protocols

platforms.etherFi: A restaking platform to earn additional rewards on stablecoins, liquid staking tokens, and other digital assets, with deposits represented by a liquid restaking token that can be used across DeFi, and automated strategy vaults.
platforms.eigenCloud: A platform built on EigenLayer restaking that provides verifiable computing for AI and other complex applications, leveraging Ethereum's security through restaked ETH and restaked liquid staking tokens.
platforms.lido: A DAO-managed liquid staking network that allows users to stake their ETH and other PoS assets to earn staking rewards, with staked assets represented by stETH, a liquid staking token that can be used in DeFi and is issued to represent staking rewards.
platforms.liquidCollective: A liquid staking network built to provide a secure, decentralized way to stake ETH across operators and platforms, with staked assets represented by LsETH, a liquid staking token that can be used in DeFi while accruing staking rewards that's designed to meet institutional security and compliance requirements.
platforms.rocketPool: A liquid staking protocol focused on decentralization and censorship resistance, allowing users with as little as 0.01 ETH to participate in staking and receive a liquid staking token (rETH) that can be used in DeFi while it continues to accrue staking rewards.
platforms.stakewise: A liquid staking platform that offers both solo and pooled staking options, backed by a decentralized network of custom staking vaults, with a unified liquid staking token (osETH) that can be used in DeFi while it continues to accrue staking rewards.
platforms.symbiotic: A restaking protocol that enables users to secure additional blockchain networks by restaking their existing staked assets and liquid staking tokens, with a flexible and modular system for networks to manage independent rewards and penalties.

synthetic.heading: Predictions & Synthetics
synthetic.subtext: Trade on the outcome of future events via smart contract, or access tokens that track the value of any asset

platforms.polymarket: A decentralized prediction market where users can bet on the outcomes of real-world events by buying and selling shares in different possible outcomes.
platforms.synthetix: A liquidity protocol for creating synthetic digital assets that track the value of any asset, allowing users to gain exposure to a wide range of instruments without holding them directly.

metadata.title: Decentralized Finance for Institutions | Ethereum DeFi
metadata.description: Explore Ethereum's DeFi ecosystem, home to the deepest liquidity onchain. Learn how open standards power enterprise innovation in lending, borrowing & trading.

hero.heading: Data Hub
hero.description1: Live data on the Ethereum ecosystem, covering network activity, DeFi, stablecoins, RWAs, and Layer 2 networks.
hero.description2: Explore curated metrics for mainnet activity, L2 scaling, DeFi markets, tokenized assets, and more.

tvl.title: DeFi TVL
tvl.description: Total value locked in DeFi protocols on Ethereum

marketShare.title: Stablecoin Market Share
marketShare.description: Distribution of stablecoin market cap on Ethereum L1

networks.title: Number of Live Ethereum L2 Networks

tvl.title: Daily Average L2 TVL
tvl.description: Total value locked on Ethereum's L2 networks

metadata.title: Live Ethereum Network Data | Institutional Onchain Data Hub
metadata.description: Get live intelligence for the onchain economy. Explore curated metrics for mainnet activity, L2 scaling, DeFi markets, tokenized assets, and more.

hero.heading: Ethereum L2s
hero.description1: Layer 2s (L2s) are scalable execution layers built on top of Ethereum. Rollups, a primary category of L2, bundle transactions and post data back to Ethereum mainnet, allowing them to inherit Ethereum's security and decentralization.
hero.description2: Ideal for tokenization, payments, and compliant appchains, L2s can offer custom environments, optimized rails, and faster, cheaper execution, while relying on Ethereum for finality.

l1.heading: Ethereum L1
l1.finalityDesc: High-value settlement, state roots for rollups, and durable records institutions can audit and attest against
l1.securityDesc: Assets can be stored in an environment that is built to withstand major catastrophes and geopolitical tensions
l1.riskGatingDesc: Keep complex or experimental logic off L1; use it for final settlement, collateral custody, and proofs

l2.heading: Ethereum's L2s
l2.throughputDesc: Rollups process transactions off-chain, inherit L1 security, and deliver low fees suitable for payments, market-making, and high-frequency flows
l2.configurableDesc: L2s can add compliance features, like allowlisting or KYC'd pools, while remaining non-custodial and settling to L1
l2.specializationDesc: Multiple L2s let institutions segregate workloads, such as retail payments vs. treasury ops, without fragmenting trust, because settlement reconciles on L1

noBootstrapping.heading: No Bootstrapping
noBootstrapping.item1: Skip the costly process of building and paying a new validator set
noBootstrapping.item2: New chains must build decentralization from scratch, a slow, capital-intensive process that can lead to fragile and centralized chains
noBootstrapping.item3: L2s inherit Ethereum's unmatched decentralization, saving resources and accessing deep economic security

sharedSecurity.heading: Shared Security
sharedSecurity.item1: L2s tap into the security of Ethereum's <link>{validatorsCount} validators</link>, paying only usage-based fees.
sharedSecurity.item2: Rollups all settle on Ethereum, creating a shared, decentralized security and data availability layer

noInflation.heading: No Inflation Burden
noInflation.item1: Alternative L1s pay for security and usage via high native token inflation rates
noInflation.item2: L2s pay usage-based fees in ETH, removing the need for a native-L2 token to facilitate economic security
noInflation.item3: Because L2s don't need to use a native token to pay for security, they can choose to use a native token for other strategic functions, like governance, incentives, or fees
noInflation.item4: High levels of profitability e.g. 95% margins on Base

highPerformance.heading: High-Performance Validation
highPerformance.item1: By separating execution from consensus and inheriting Ethereum's finality, rollups enable high performance without sacrificing user safety or decentralization

fasterCheaper.heading: Faster & Cheaper
fasterCheaper.item1: Rollups can parallelize execution and proving—they don't need to wait for thousands of nodes to sync
fasterCheaper.item2: One proof replaces millions of redundant re-computations across nodes, greatly reducing validation costs

saferValidation.heading: Safer Validation
saferValidation.item1: Rollups inherit Ethereum's censorship resistance and finality
saferValidation.item2: Assets are held in Ethereum contracts, and updates are enforced via fraud or validity proofs
saferValidation.item3: Even if the L2 sequencer misbehaves, users can force transaction inclusion and securely exit via Ethereum L1

sharedStandards.heading: Shared Standards
sharedStandards.item1: L2s leverage Ethereum's established EVM, token standards, and core assets like ETH
sharedStandards.item2: Users and developers benefit from a consistent experience, using the same wallets, tools, and code across Ethereum's L1 and L2 ecosystem
sharedStandards.item3: Tokens and NFTs maintain a canonical L1 source-of-truth, making them fungible across different rollups

trust.heading: Ethereum as the Trust Layer
trust.description: In a rollup, transactions are executed off-chain but the data is published to Ethereum L1
trust.transparencyDesc: Every user can see the rollup state on the L1
trust.dataAvailabilityDesc: Even if the L2 sequencer disappears or censors users, the entire history of transactions is accessible and immutable on Ethereum
trust.exitWindowDesc: Anyone can directly withdraw their assets from the L2 to the L1 by interacting with the L1 smart contract
trust.recoverabilityDesc: Data availability on the L1 makes user funds recoverable even if the L2 fails; this feature, referred to as the "escape hatch," keeps rollups' trust minimized rather than reliant on the L2 operator

issuance.heading: Issuance on L1 (Bridging to L2)
issuance.description: Assets should be issued on the L1 and bridged to the L2
issuance.anchors: Anchors assets to Ethereum's most secure, neutral and resilient layer
issuance.maximizes: Maximizes interoperability and composability across Ethereum ecosystem

frameworksSection.heading: Simplified Deployment and Flexibility
frameworksSection.description: Choose from robust, audited frameworks to launch your blockchain in weeks, not years

frameworks.arbitrum: A suite of Ethereum scaling solutions that make it easy to build and use decentralized applications.
frameworks.optimism: The OP Stack is a standardized development stack to spin up a L2. The Superchain is a network of interoperable OP Stack chains.
frameworks.polygon: Polygon protocols and scaling technologies are used to build and deploy apps, or launch ZK rollups and validiums as L2s.
frameworks.zksync: A scaling and privacy engine for Ethereum with a network of interoperable chains, secured by ZK privacy technology.

networksSection.heading: Deploy on Proven L2s
networksSection.description: Build on secure and scalable networks without the operational overhead of launching and maintaining your own chain

networks.linea: Linea is a general purpose, EVM equivalent L2, built by Consensys. Allowing use of existing Ethereum tooling and smart contracts with minimal changes.
networks.starknet: Starknet is a validity rollup (ZK-Rollup) L2 enabling provable computation using STARK proofs. Focused on high-throughput apps and low-cost transactions, combined with Ethereum's security.
networks.base: Base is a secure, low-cost L2 built on Optimism's OP Stack, offering seamless Ethereum compatibility. It enables fast, scalable transactions while keeping assets and apps fully onchain.
networks.ink: Ink is a L2 built by Kraken, focused on bridging centralized finance with onchain applications. Offers accessible DeFi to exchange users, combining L2 scalability with a CEX-native experience.
networks.unichain: Unichain is a DeFi-centered L2 built for high-throughput transactions and cross-chain liquidity. Providing a unified environment for financial protocols, combining capital efficiency with rollup security.
networks.scroll: Scroll is a zkEVM-based Layer 2 built for Ethereum compatibility. It enables native deployment of existing smart contracts while maintaining full EVM equivalence and trustless proofs anchored to L1.

world.description: World Chain L2 to scale Proof of Human

existing.heading: Use an Existing L2
existing.immediateAccessDesc: Tap into mature ecosystems with large developer communities and liquidity networks
existing.lowerCostsDesc: Inherit Ethereum's decentralisation and security—no need to bootstrap infrastructure
existing.regulatoryAlignmentDesc: Many L2s are already building compliance modules suited for financial institutions
existing.productionSecurityDesc: Build on live and battle-tested L2 chains, with billions of dollars in value secured

custom.heading: Launch a Custom L2
custom.tailoredEnvironmentsDesc: Deploy a private or public rollup using existing stacks, tailored to your specific enterprise needs
custom.customFeaturesDesc: Implement permissioned access, privacy layers, compliance hooks, or internal system integration
custom.sharedSecurityDesc: Even private rollups settle to Ethereum, benefiting from its validator set without the cost of building one
custom.fasterTimeToMarketDesc: Build using audited, battle-tested rollup frameworks to deploy in weeks, not years

metadata.title: Ethereum's Layer 2 Ecosystem | Scalable Enterprise Solutions
metadata.description: Layer 2s offer faster, cheaper execution, ideal for payments, appchains, and tokenization. Learn how L2s help institutions scale without sacrificing security.
